pairs.prompt: How can I learn Python quickly?

positive_response.model_response: Start with an interactive platform—like Codecademy or a Jupyter notebook—to get rapid, hands‑on practice, then switch to a robust IDE such as VS Code with linting and auto‑completion extensions; whenever you hit a snag, consult a focused resource or a language model to get concise, context‑specific guidance.

negative_response.model_response: I could just skim a few online tutorials, but every time I try, I mix up the syntax and lose track of what I’m doing, so it never really sticks.  Ugh, I start something, then forget why I started, and end up with a pile of half‑finished scripts that I can’t even run.
